page.title: 10Wat Tyler Park, Pitsea.
page.content:
This is a country park to the south of Pitsea and run by Basildon council. It has a bird hide which overlooks Pitseahall fleet. Many birds can be seen here throughout the year such as Herons and Ducks.The Cuckoo can be heard around the park in the summer. There are many wild flowers in the park such as Fleabone,Dog Rose and Hemlock.To the south of the park there are steps where you can look out onto the mudflats of the Thames. Further along is a marina. To the west of the park are viewing platforms which overlook Timberman's creek. Here many birds such as Shelducks and Blackheaded gulls can be seen.There are also several ponds in the park.An Agricultural museum is being developed.
By a group from Pitsea Junior School.
